Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller.commands

Interface UserCommand

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCommand, ChooseMageCommand, CommonCommandParsingTest.MockUserCommand, JoinCommand, LeaveCommand, MoveMnCommand, MoveStudentCommand, PickCloudCommand, PlayAssistantsCommand, PlayCharacterCommand, SingleArgumentCommand
public interface UserCommand
Represents a user action in a client application. They contain the state modification associated with a given command type and its arguments.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Phase
    execute(Phase phase)
    Executes this command on the given Phase.
    long
    getGameId()
    Returns the id of the game this command is for.
    String
    getModificationMessage()
    Returns a human-readable string describing what modifications the command will do to the given phase.
    UserCommandType
    getType()
    Returns the UserCommandType associated with this instance
    String
    getUsername()
    Returns the username associated with this command

  • Method Details

    • execute

      Phase execute(Phase phase) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException, InvalidPlayerException, InvalidCharacterParameterException
      Executes this command on the given Phase. It returns a new Phase representing the final state after command execution. If the updates done by this command would lead to an illegal configuration, an exception will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      phase - The Phase to update
      Returns:
      a new Phase object with the updates applied
      Throws:
      InvalidPlayerException - if the Player linked to this command does not have permission to execute the action this command represents
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the update would lead to an illegal game state
      InvalidCharacterParameterException - if the parameters passed to character card invocation are not formatted correctly
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the update uses operations unsupported in the particular state the game is in

    • getType

      UserCommandType getType()
      Returns the UserCommandType associated with this instance
      Returns:
      the UserCommandType associated with this instance

      Returns the id of the game this command is for.
